title: Will a tropical storm make landfall in Florida by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a tropical storm, as defined by the National Hurricane Center, makes landfall in the state of Florida by August 31, 2024. Landfall is defined as the center of the storm crossing the coastline. The resolution will be based on official reports from the National Hurricane Center or equivalent authoritative sources. If no tropical storm makes landfall in Florida by the specified date, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Florida declare another state of emergency due to flooding by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the state of Florida declares an official state of emergency specifically due to flooding by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made by the Governor of Florida and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (such as CNN, BBC, or The New York Times). If no such state of emergency is declared by the specified date, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a Delaware judge vacate the ruling requiring Tesla to rescind Elon Musk's pay package by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a Delaware judge vacates the ruling that requires Tesla to rescind Elon Musk's pay package. The vacating of the ruling must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation by these reporting news organizations. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such a vacating.

title: Will TikTok settle the lawsuit with the Justice Department by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, TikTok settles the lawsuit filed by the Justice Department accusing the company of illegally collecting children's data. A settlement is defined as an agreement reached between TikTok and the Justice Department, which resolves the allegations without a trial. The settlement must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, this question will resolve as NO.

A guilty verdict must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic Party's nominee for president by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Kamala Harris is officially recognized as the Democratic Party's nominee for president for the upcoming election. The confirmation must come from an official announcement by the Democratic National Committee (DNC) or through a widely recognized and reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such confirmation is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the Nasdaq 100 Index recover to its previous high before August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the Nasdaq 100 Index reaches or exceeds its previous high (the level before it entered correction territory) at any point before August 1, 2024. The previous high is defined as the highest closing value of the Nasdaq 100 Index prior to the correction mentioned in the article. The resolution will be based on official closing values reported by Nasdaq.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the practice of Nüshu script is officially recognized by a major cultural institution. A major cultural institution is defined as an organization such as UNESCO, a national museum, or a well-known cultural heritage organization. The recognition must be explicitly stated in an official announcement or publication by the institution and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation by these reporting news organizations. This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such recognition.

title: Will another significant East-West prisoner swap occur between the United States and Russia by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, another significant prisoner swap occurs between the United States and Russia. A 'significant' prisoner swap is defined as involving at least one high-profile individual from each side, such as a journalist, political dissident, or corporate executive, similar to the recent swap involving Evan Gershkovich and Paul Whelan. The event must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be further mass protests in Nigeria by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are reports of further mass protests occurring in Nigeria. Mass protests are defined as public gatherings of at least 1,000 people protesting against economic conditions or government actions. The protests must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of such protests.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) concludes its investigation into the April crash near Seattle involving a Tesla operating on the company's Full Self-Driving system. If the investigation is still ongoing or no official conclusion is announced by the resolution date, this question will resolve as NO.
